description.narrative: Northern districts of Cabo Delgado Province in Mozambique have been under attacks of non-estate armed groups (NSAGs) since October 2017, a situation that has induced massive displacement of over 900,000 people . The conflict in Cabo Delgado, which is coupled by the repercussions from the Cyclone Kenneth and impact of COVID-19 outbreak continues to disrupt and worsen the livelihood activities,leading to a loss of typical food and income sources. Households affected by conflict continue to experience Crisis (IPC Phase 3) as they have little food stocks and low purchasing power. The latest IPC assessment projected period (November 2021 - March 2022) estimates 1,9 million people across Mozambique will experience acute food insecurity (IPC 3+) during the lean season. Around 932 000 are in Cabo Delgado and 400 000 in Niassa, Nampula and Zambezia where conflict affected IDPs are located. Pockets of emergency (IPC 4)outcomes have been estimated in Mueda, Nangade and Palma. At least 38% of host communities in Cabo Delgado are experiencing IPC 3+ outcomes. 55% of Pemba’s population are estimated to be experiencing acute food insecurity . The goal of the project is to improve access to food, WASH infrastructure and deliver gender sensitive protection services for targeted communities. With this project, Oxfam and its partners aim to reach a total of 68,500 people (women, men, boys, and girls) affected by conflict and climate changes in Mozambique. Oxfam in Southern Africa will directly manage and implement this multisectoral project in partnership with local organizations drawn from Mozambique. A key component will be safe programming, which will also raise awareness on gender, protection amongst communities affected by conflict, food and nutrition insecurity inMozambique.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
